page.title: 14Yarm Traffic Lights
page.content: On the 26th of June 1985 between 10.35 a.m. and 11.14 a.m. one hundred and fifty nine people,one bike and three dogs crossed over the High Street.{Pelican crossings}are used to get people across safely. A bridge over,or a subway under,the road could be built to save the time of car drivers and shoppers. As the button was pressed 48 times in 39 minutes the average person crosses in less than a minute. In Yarm there are two crossings, one near the Town Hall and one near the Fish and Chips shop but one bridge would be suitable.
